str2: If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.
From hamartano; a sin.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From hamartano; a sin.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
